title: How to set the DPI in Adobe InDesign - Quora

response.answer_text: The dpi of any document created in indesign can only be specified when exporting to an appropriate file format (PDF, JPG etc). There is no default setting.  This allows greater flexibility to specify a range of export qualities to enable smaller file sizes for proofing and larger, quality outputs when creating documents for print etc. It's worth noting that lower quality linked images within an indesign document won't improve with higher export settings, so always use the best quality imagery appropriate to your desired output. For example: ~300dpi CMYK imagery for print.

DPI can’t be set in Indesign, instead correct DPI is determined automatically for each printer. If images look too pixelated Indesign might be having problem with printer drivers. Solution I found was to disable Optimized Subsampling inPrint > Graphics > Images > Send Data. With “All” option DPI was greatly improved.
